meanings.definition: A device on a boat that holds an oar in place while rowing.
meanings.sent1: The oarlock kept the oar steady as we rowed across the lake.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the oar is properly placed in the oarlock before rowing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the oarlock was a fun swing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed over the water, bouncing off the oarlock.
meanings.sent5: The shiny oarlock gleamed in the sunlight, guiding our way.

meanings.definition: To secure an oar in an oarlock.
meanings.sent1: He carefully oarlocked the oar before starting to row.
meanings.sent2: Remember to oarlock the oar tightly to avoid it slipping out.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to oarlock her pencil in the imaginary boat.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like oarlocking his dreams in place.
meanings.sent5: The sound of oarlocking filled the air as the rowing team prepared to race.
